### Getting R

Download it from the CRAN page at

```
cloud.r-project.org
```

![CRAN page](./figures/cran_page.png)

Click on  the appropriate download link for your operating system and follow the installation instructions.
---

### Getting RStudio

Do this _after_ you have downloaded R. Download it from


```
https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/
```

![RS page1](./figures/rs1.png)

### On your machine you will see these icons



.pull-left[

![R icon](./figures/r_icon.png)

__R__  
__Never__ open this
]

.pull-right[
![RS icon](./figures/rs_icon.png)

__R Studio__  
__Always__ open this
]
 
  

R is the engine, RStudio is the 'IDE' - the window through which you use R.  
IDE = 'Integrated Development Environment'
